etymologies: late 19th century: from Golliwogg, the name of a doll character in books by Bertha Upton (died 1912), American writer, and Florence K. Upton (died 1922), American illustrator; perhaps suggested by golly and polliwog

definitions: a soft doll with bright clothes, a black face, and fuzzy hair.
shortDefinitions: soft doll with bright clothes, black face
